blog.name: charlotteevansauthor
blog.title: Everything and Nothing
blog.description: I write stories and poetry. I also love Game of Thrones and ASOIAF.

title: Arya Stark - End Game - Season 8
body:
And now for my favourite character. What is going to happen to Arya in Season 8 of Game of Thrones. I have already gone through some of this with my Jon post but here is a more in depth breakdown of our favourite Assassin (except Zevran).

Episode 1.

I think before the big intro with Dany and Jon arriving in Winterfell there will be an establishing scene of Arya and some of the people in Winter town - you know so when most of them die we feel bad. There has been some talk that in this season she has a meaningful scene with a child so potentially she is teaching the kids how to fight. As Tyrion was also not at the original meeting of Robert B and Ned in Season 1 as he was in Winter town he might also be show up there as well.

Now that she and Sansa have buried the hatchet (in Littlefingers head) there will be a scene with them and Bran where they discuss Jon, what he did and the ramifications of it. Possibly this is where Bran tells Sansa and Arya about Jon’s parents which would lead into the next episode.

This will likely also be where she has her reunions with the Hound and Gendry and honestly it’s a coin toss how she will react to either of them.

Episode 2.

As I mentioned on Jon’s post I believe Arya will be the one to talk him out of his funk. They have a short amount of time and tying the reunion scene together with Jon recovering from his BSOD kills two birds with one stone.

There will be a scene with everyone preparing for the inevitable attack and at some point Dany and Arya with have a conversation and Arya will not hold back with Dany as she isn’t politically minded like Sansa. She will be testing her to she how she reacts. I also think once it comes out that Sam’s father and brother were killed she will be very cautious of her as she could see this as an abuse of authority which we all know Arya is not a fan of.

Episode 3.

Arya will likely have some real time to shine here because if she doesn’t kill at least one White Walker I would be very surprised. I think they will likely be caught slightly unaware by the attack and she will go out to try and save the people of the town she gets some of them out but looks like she is swarmed but Wights and potentially we think she is going to die. There are two ways I see this going - the first is the wolf pack arrives and saves her (I will call it now if they show up and she gets circled like Dany has been and Jon as well then I am guaranteed right about the ending of the series). The second way it could go is she actually does die and Beric uses his last life to save her as a call back to Lady Stoneheart though if this happens the wolf pack will just have to show up later but there is no way they can tease an army of wolves last season and not use them.

As I said last time they win but the Night King tricked them and has gone further South.

Episode 4.

Jon goes to Kingslanding to strenuous objections from everyone and he gives a bit of sass back especially to Arya if she did go to Winter Town to save everyone. He immediately gets caught and Arya goes with the Hound to save him and have some sweet revenge on the side while they are there. Jaime might go with them. Remember from Season one Arya actually knows some secret ways into the Red Keep and with her faces she will likely be able to get in quite easily. Obviously since Jon will have flown down on Rhaegal they will use Varys’ teleportation skills to get there quickly. Cleganebowl happens but likely Cersei lives until at least the next episode.

Episode 5 and 6.

They all get together and talk about their feelings and realise the Nights King isn't such a bad guy - he just need a hug. Or there is a huge battle and a bunch of people kill each other. It could go either way. Arya will probably kill another White Walker and loads of people will die. After as they argue over politics she has the slow dawning horror of realisation that they are asking her to shag her cousin who she thought was her brother. They do it for political stability but after a few years - maybe once Jon and Dany are both dead many years later she leaves with the Hound her true Bromantic love interest and they finally go out in search of what is West of Westeros.

That might be a little bit too happy of an ending but she is my favourite so allow me the hope of her riding into the sunset at least.

And now for my favourite character. What is going to happen to Arya in Season 8 of Game of Thrones. I have already gone through some of this with my Jon post but here is a more in depth breakdown of our favourite Assassin (except Zevran).

Episode 1.

I think before the big intro with Dany and Jon arriving in Winterfell there will be an establishing scene of Arya and some of the people in Winter town - you know so when most of them die we feel bad. There has been some talk that in this season she has a meaningful scene with a child so potentially she is teaching the kids how to fight. As Tyrion was also not at the original meeting of Robert B and Ned in Season 1 as he was in Winter town he might also be show up there as well.

Now that she and Sansa have buried the hatchet (in Littlefingers head) there will be a scene with them and Bran where they discuss Jon, what he did and the ramifications of it. Possibly this is where Bran tells Sansa and Arya about Jon’s parents which would lead into the next episode.

This will likely also be where she has her reunions with the Hound and Gendry and honestly it’s a coin toss how she will react to either of them.

Episode 2.

As I mentioned on Jon’s post I believe Arya will be the one to talk him out of his funk. They have a short amount of time and tying the reunion scene together with Jon recovering from his BSOD kills two birds with one stone.

There will be a scene with everyone preparing for the inevitable attack and at some point Dany and Arya with have a conversation and Arya will not hold back with Dany as she isn’t politically minded like Sansa. She will be testing her to she how she reacts. I also think once it comes out that Sam’s father and brother were killed she will be very cautious of her as she could see this as an abuse of authority which we all know Arya is not a fan of.

Episode 3.

Arya will likely have some real time to shine here because if she doesn’t kill at least one White Walker I would be very surprised. I think they will likely be caught slightly unaware by the attack and she will go out to try and save the people of the town she gets some of them out but looks like she is swarmed but Wights and potentially we think she is going to die. There are two ways I see this going - the first is the wolf pack arrives and saves her (I will call it now if they show up and she gets circled like Dany has been and Jon as well then I am guaranteed right about the ending of the series). The second way it could go is she actually does die and Beric uses his last life to save her as a call back to Lady Stoneheart though if this happens the wolf pack will just have to show up later but there is no way they can tease an army of wolves last season and not use them.

As I said last time they win but the Night King tricked them and has gone further South.

Episode 4.

Jon goes to Kingslanding to strenuous objections from everyone and he gives a bit of sass back especially to Arya if she did go to Winter Town to save everyone. He immediately gets caught and Arya goes with the Hound to save him and have some sweet revenge on the side while they are there. Jaime might go with them. Remember from Season one Arya actually knows some secret ways into the Red Keep and with her faces she will likely be able to get in quite easily. Obviously since Jon will have flown down on Rhaegal they will use Varys’ teleportation skills to get there quickly. Cleganebowl happens but likely Cersei lives until at least the next episode.

Episode 5 and 6.

They all get together and talk about their feelings and realise the Nights King isn't such a bad guy - he just need a hug. Or there is a huge battle and a bunch of people kill each other. It could go either way. Arya will probably kill another White Walker and loads of people will die. After as they argue over politics she has the slow dawning horror of realisation that they are asking her to shag her cousin who she thought was her brother. They do it for political stability but after a few years - maybe once Jon and Dany are both dead many years later she leaves with the Hound her true Bromantic love interest and they finally go out in search of what is West of Westeros.

That might be a little bit too happy of an ending but she is my favourite so allow me the hope of her riding into the sunset at least.

summary:
Arya: Just so you know, if you go to jail, I'm not waiting for you. 
Gendry: You won't have to. I'll escape. We both know that.
body:
Arya: Just so you know, if you go to jail, I’m not waiting for you.

Gendry: You won’t have to. I’ll escape. We both know that.

reblog.comment:

trail.content:

Gendry: You won’t have to. I’ll escape. We both know that.

summary:
Jon: You have a date ? Who with ?
Arya: No one.
Jon: C'mon, what's his name ?
Arya: He has no name.
Jon: Come on, tell me.
Arya:...
body:
Jon: You have a date ? Who with ?
Arya: No one.
Jon: C'mon, what's his name ?
Arya: He has no name.
Jon: Come on, tell me.
Arya: All right, but I'm very excited about this, okay, so you gotta promise you won't get all big-brothery and judgmental.
Jon: Oh, I promise. What ?
Arya: It's Jaqen H'ghar.
Jon: Who's Jaqen H'ghar ? Jaq... Jaqen H'ghar ? You have a date with Jaqen H'ghar ? Why, why, why should that bother me? I, I love that man, he's like a, uh, a professional hitman.

dialogue.name: Jon
dialogue.label: Jon:
dialogue.phrase: You have a date ? Who with ?

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: All right, but I'm very excited about this, okay, so you gotta promise you won't get all big-brothery and judgmental.

dialogue.name: Jon
dialogue.label: Jon:
dialogue.phrase: Who's Jaqen H'ghar ? Jaq... Jaqen H'ghar ? You have a date with Jaqen H'ghar ? Why, why, why should that bother me? I, I love that man, he's like a, uh, a professional hitman.

summary:
Arya Stark x Gendry Baratheon modern au. 
Gendry Baratheon's mother died while she birthed him. He grew up with his father and...
body:
Arya Stark x Gendry Baratheon modern au.

Gendry Baratheon’s mother died while she birthed him. He grew up with his father and his most tragic love and of course he hated this.

He has'nt got any problem with Starks. He likes them actually. Robb and Jon are like brothers for him and Edric likes Bran and Rickon too. They are a team as their fathers were. But there was a woman too. She’s beautiful, wilfull and dead before her time. He never met her. But he knows her like his father’s knew.

He swear it to himself that he never love a woman like Lyanna Stark.

Comes and goes all at once.

But then he fell in love a girl who has ‘most tragic love’s face. And all the swears collapsed.

summary: Is there a chance that someone from Stark kids will die next season? I'm quite sure Sansa is surviving, but don't know about...
question: Is there a chance that someone from Stark kids will die next season? I'm quite sure Sansa is surviving, but don't know about Bran and Arya. Especially Arya.
answer: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

reblog.comment: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

trail.content_raw: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.
trail.content: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

tags: that's how you respond to a request of privacy??
and yet you try to potray yourselves as victims
summary: The fact that some ppl would cross all limits and then continue to do so after someone requests them not to do it (like bringing...
body:
The fact that some ppl would cross all limits and then continue to do so after someone requests them not to do it (like bringing up personal family matters), just for the sake of discourse just simply sickens me. Also the fact that when requested to respect the privacy and boundaries, this person replied with a ‘quit crying to me’ is simply something horrendous.

I am sorry for putting this in Arya’s tag but the way @hufflepuffdisaster ’s family got dragged just bc of a fandom discourse is gross.

reblog.comment:
The fact that some ppl would cross all limits and then continue to do so after someone requests them not to do it (like bringing up personal family matters), just for the sake of discourse just simply sickens me. Also the fact that when requested to respect the privacy and boundaries, this person replied with a ‘quit crying to me’ is simply something horrendous.

I am sorry for putting this in Arya’s tag but the way @hufflepuffdisaster ’s family got dragged just bc of a fandom discourse is gross.

Also the fact that when requested to respect the privacy and boundaries, this person replied with a ‘quit crying to me’ is simply something horrendous.

I am sorry for putting this in Arya’s tag but the way @hufflepuffdisaster ’s family got dragged just bc of a fandom discourse is gross.

summary: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all...
body: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all fine… we even cross lines and have insane discourses and make hateful posts. but my grandparents, mainly my grandfather, is being dragged into a fandom discourse as a “gross man” because @sayruq and @cmollyo want to make a point. can you guys please learn to have boundaries? don’t fucking insult people’s families because they disagree with you, don’t fucking insult people’s families when you don’t know anything about them. it’s the second time people shit on my grandparents. THE SECOND TIME.

THE SECOND TIME.

summary: arya isn’t just some killer. she doesn’t kill without rhyme or reason. any time she took a life it was because someone was being...
body:
arya isn’t just some killer. she doesn’t kill without rhyme or reason. any time she took a life it was because someone was being immediately threatened or harmed, or this person had done a great wrong to her or someone she knew in the past. she doesn’t simply kill people, and she doesn’t enjoy taking lives. idk how this isn’t a simple fucking concept for some people.

if you think about it, jon snow has killed more people than arya has. i don’t see people calling him a killer, murderer, or murder child. in fact, most of the men in asoiaf have a higher kill count than she does. this is sexism plain and simple.

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary:
“i look like an oak tree, with all these stupid acorns” 

 “nice, though. a nice oak tree.” 

 if arya/gendry as a ship had a...
body:
“i look like an oak tree, with all these stupid acorns” 

“nice, though. a nice oak tree.” 

if arya/gendry as a ship had a color it would be green. with the acorn dress, trees, nature, and riverlands associated with them that is their color. its a perfect fit. it represents growth. arya and gendry are just children now but their relationship will grow into something strong like an oak tree. green also represents safety, spring and renewal something i believe the future will hold for both of them. because you can be my forest love and me your forest lass. green is a color of harmony too. arya and gendry’s complementary traits and similar experiences (and hearts) make them a balanced pair.
